intro: Phyteuma tenerum subvar. ibericum, commonly known as the Iberian phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Spain and Portugal. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has linear to lanceolate leaves and produces elongated, cylindrical flower clusters. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
